author: andreas
content:
It's really the wind at this height and the fact that the snow is less wet, more fine-grained. Just put an ultra-wide at f11 anywhere near the ground, try to get some side light, and you can't fail getting an interesting picture ğŸ™‚

Well, at the moment I don't feel exactly like hanging around on the mountain, but I really think I'll have to go up one more time this winter ğŸ˜„
